column7: The incorporation of structural analysis into the technical design of theatrical scenery has become a necessary tool for every Technical Director. This course is a study of the foundational vocabulary, the mathematical equations, and the graphical representations that are used to assist in solving these design challenges. Knowledge of these foundational ideas will help students to make more informed and structurally sound technical designs. 3 undergraduate hours. 3 graduate hours. May be repeated to a maximum of 6 undergraduate hours in separate semesters. Prerequisite: THEA 126. Enrollment limited to Theatre majors or by consent of instructor.
